com.cyc.kb

Interface Sentence

  • All Superinterfaces:
    KBObject
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ForAllQuantifiedInstanceRestrictedVariable, InstanceRestrictedVariable, QuantifiedInstanceRestrictedVariable, QuantifiedRestrictedVariable, RestrictedVariable, SentenceImpl, SpecializationRestrictedVariable, ThereExistsQuantifiedInstanceRestrictedVariable

    public interface Sentence
extends KBObject
    The interface for Cyc sentences. Sentences encode propositions, which can be used as questions (in a Query) or claims (in an Assertion).
    Since:
    1.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

    • Method Detail

      • assertIn

        Assertion assertIn(Context ctx)
                   throws KBApiException
        Assert this sentence in the context ctx. In many cases, it will be useful to call isAssertible(com.cyc.kb.Context) before asserting a sentence.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context where this sentence will be asserted.
        Returns:
        the Assertion object, either a Fact or a Rule.
        Throws:
        KBApiException - if the assertion fails for any reason, include being syntactically invalid.

      • isAssertible

        boolean isAssertible(Context ctx)
        Checks if a given sentence meets the constraints necessary to be assertible in ctx. In particular, returns true if the arguments of the sentence are compatible with the argument constraints of the operator (i.e. could be made to actually meet the constraints without removing any existing assertions). For sentences with predicate operators, the arguments must also be compatible with all relevant interArg* constraints. In some cases, additional requirements are imposed (e.g. the constraints must actually be known to be met, not just not be known to be incompatible). For an explanation of why a particular sentence is not assertible, check notAssertibleExplanation(com.cyc.kb.Context)
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context where semantic constraints are checked
        Returns:
        if the sentence is compatible with all relevant syntactic and semantic constraints, and is therefore assertible.
        Throws:
        CycApiException - if unable to determine whether constraints are met.

      • notAssertibleExplanation

        String notAssertibleExplanation(Context ctx)
        Return an explanation of why the sentence is not assertible. Note that this reason may not be exhaustive; once the problems mentioned in the reason are fixed, additional calls to this method may turn up additional problems.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context where semantic constraints are checked
        Returns:
        a detailed explanation of why a sentence is not assertible. Returns null if it encounters an internal error.

      • replaceTerms

        Sentence replaceTerms(List<Object> from,
                    List<Object> to)
                      throws KBTypeException,
                             CreateException
        For each element of from replace it with the element of to that's at the same index. This does not modify the original Sentence, but instead returns a new sentence.
        Parameters:
        from - a list of objects that will be replaced if found
        to - a list of objects that will be in the new modified sentence
        Returns:
        a new Sentence with the replaced terms
        Throws:
        KBTypeException
        CreateException

                  throws KBTypeException,
                         CreateException
        Throws:
        KBTypeException
        CreateException

      • expandSentence

        Sentence expandSentence()
                        throws KBApiException
        This is not part of the public, supported KB API.
        Returns:
        the expanded sentence
        Throws:
        KBApiException

      • getListOfTypedVariables

        Collection<KBTerm> getListOfTypedVariables()
        This is not part of the public, supported KB API.
        Returns:
        a list of typed variables in a sentence.

      • getArgPositionsForTerm

        Set<ArgPosition> getArgPositionsForTerm(Object term)
        Returns a set of arg positions that describe all the locations where the given term can be found in this formula.
        Parameters:
        term - The term to search for
        Returns:
        The set of all arg positions where term can be found
